text:
*[Bug 18938] seq.Date inconsistent on whether to= can be a string*
<https://bugs.r-project.org/show_bug.cgi?id=18938>

Aakriti Kushwaha (<mailto:aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.com|aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.com>) changed:

           What    |Removed                     |Added
----------------------------------------------------------------------------
                 CC|                            |aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.c
                   |                            |om

--- Comment #7 from Aakriti Kushwaha (<mailto:aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.com|aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.com>) ---
Hi,

I noticed that seq.Date behaves inconsistently when the 'to' argument is a
string. 
I created a small test file that reproduces the behavior:

- seq(as.Date("2025-01-01"), "2025-01-07") works
- seq(as.Date("2025-01-01"), "2025-01-07", by = 1) fails

This test file can be used to reproduce the issue and help with investigating a
potential fix. 
I've attached the file below.

--- Comment #8 from Aakriti Kushwaha (<mailto:aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.com|aakriti.kushwaha.ak@gmail.com>) ---
Created attachment 3597
  --> <https://bugs.r-project.org/attachment.cgi?id=3597&action=edit>
This test reproduces Bug 18938: seq.Date behaves inconsistently when the 'to'
argument is a string.  It shows that seq(from, to) works without 'by', but
fails when 'by = 1' is used.  I created this te

Attaching a simple test case for Bug 18938. 
It demonstrates the current inconsistent behavior of seq.Date with string 'to'
values.
